name: Introduction to Infrastructure
description: This course explores how society, culture, and understanding of the human condition influence, and are influenced by, technological development. It focuses on the study of interdependent and institutionalized systems of law, economics, culture and technology, exploring the conditions of stability and instability in these systems. We will survey the available theories and methods for understanding large scale socio-technological systems, including the social construction of technology, technological determinism, and feminist technology studies. [24L, 12P]
